item.description:
For more details, see the full listing:
http://www.meetup.com...

When: Thursday, April 29, 2010 6:30 PM

Where:
Suffolk Law School
120 Tremont Street
Main Function Room
Boston, MA 02108-4977

Free screening of film: Food, Inc. and Discussion after,
Jody Adams and Donald Wiest with Annie B. Copps.

It has much to do with food production and consumption in the developing world AND Asia, where the West is copied and whose developing patterns of production and consumption model those in the West, for a variety of reasons (which could be discussed - in Mandarin, if course): 1) Western businesses set up trade from and with Asia 2) Asian expoorts to the West are often carried by US carriers, who backhaul into Asia, etc. I'm bringing some Asian friends AND 4 other Meetups.

It was shown on PBS last week, with MUCH, MUCH publicity fanfare beforehand...

Many local universities have already shown Food, Inc., on their campuses to student groups (licensing for public showings can be a problem when PBS already has shown it).

A great educational event

group.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group

item.name: FREE screening of film: Food, Inc. at Suffolk Law School; Discussion after
